description: With loss of original w-, due to Scandinavian una (“to reside, dwell”), from *wonstead, from won (“to reside, dwell”) +‎ stead. More at wone, stead.
Alternatively, possibly a corruption of homestead.

entries.meaning: (UK, Scotland, dialect, archaic) A single farmhouse; a steading.
examples: The farm onsteads on many properties are old, and afford too little accommodation
